bxjslddYGl9lZiFX69M0tw.text: This was my first time going to Flipside Cafe and it won't be my last. The food was delicious and the service was timely. The lobster omelette was great, along with the potato brava! My friend had steak and eggs, which he enjoyed. The only complaint I had was the seating wasn't enough and the possibility of taking a large party there would be difficult.

photos.caption: Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Potato Bravas  Maine Lobster Omelet

8geGZLWNXJP9eMAeDHiB4A.text: To fuel up for a day at Carowinds, I wanted a good hearty brunch. Flipside hit the spot.  There are a couple of strange things about Flipside, but nothing that detracts from the experience. First, I went to download the menu on their website (to reference for writing this review), and it downloaded as a Word doc :). Second, the restaurant is in a strip mall, and if it weren't for a sandwich sign outside, it wouldn't be very inviting.  The brunch menu was perfect, and it should work for everyone from vegans to meat eaters that want bacon and eggs. I was feeling basic, so I went with the classic "Flipside Breakfast," which has biscuits and gravy, eggs, smoked bacon, and cheddar grits. My friend went with the potato hash recommended by our server. We also ordered the Carolina grits (pimento cheese and bacon ham), which was the best thing we ate. I also couldn't skip a $5 bloody mary to kick off my Saturday.  Thank you Flipside for being a great option near Carowinds. Our brunch was significantly better than any park food or hotel food we could have gotten.

pPPOUy36RJbKYD0twhMMkw.text: Our new favorite!! It was so good for lunch we came back the next day for breakfast and it didn't disappoint. For lunch we got the warm pimento cheese with the hot pretzels and let's just say it made pimento cheese a staple in our house now. My fiance had the steak with potatoes and I got the flip side burger with their famous Brussels sprouts.  the burger had bacon ham and pimento cheese on it. We even tried to recreate it at home.  For breakfast we went big. We got the shrimp and grits that won 7th place, the special with biscuit and gravy, eggs, grits, and bacon, followed by the Cinnamon Toast Crunch waffle. OMG does not describe the food. It was so amazing. The waffle is topped with the cereal and bananas foster, it's melt in your mouth good.   We will be back and can't wait to see the menu. The owner is kick ass, she came out to our table and we could say enough how awesome she is and how she hustles to make everything amazing. I highly recommend and we will see you next year!

LqwIAGANTq0kB7m8U5LdGg.text: Hubby and I went, too late for breakfast. Ordered lunch. He ordered Flip Side burger with pimiento cheese, and I the crab cake BLT with broccoli for a side. For appetizers we wanted to share the wedge and tomato soup. Wait staff brought out two separate bowls and plates, a nice touch and great service! Crab cakes were filling and made to perfection. Pimiento cheese melted in your mouth, a nice touch to the burger.

photos.caption: Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Crab cake blt
Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Wedge salad

D-bFLvlgLd0I-Gu6JUglTQ.text: Food was delicious and the environment was pleasant. There is a blackboard listing local farmers businesses they support.

hVyyPsRhyqKPn2sy17Ksbg.text: The food is well prepared using quality ingredients by a dedicated new owner and chef.  The atmosphere could use a little help, but the food and cooking talent is exactly what Fort Mill needs.  The meat loaf  isn't the norm; it's excellent.

Bvvfozo1Tum__KZKDiPgDw.text: This is a great little place! The pimento cheese and bacon grits are amazing. It's a little hard to find but well worth it. Amy, the owner, does a great job and is very friendly.

vHMSRytvuxSn_xbHk-CrxA.text: Great little place tucked away in strip mall. Be prepared to be wowed by the flavors of each dish. This is gourmet food at reasonable prices. Simply the best pimento cheese spread I have ever had. Can't wait to return.

t9gfGEzsj__73fhqhQiAow.text: My husband took me there for a rare night out, both of our teenage daughters not only enjoyed their food, but want to go back again soon.  My husband and I both enjoyed our salmon.  We always enjoy the atmosphere and "eat local" ethic in Asheville NC and I told my family it was like a small slice of Asheville here in Fort Mill, quaint, relaxed atmosphere, great food, just has that same vibe.  We will be going back!

gD1f1DF85MJpqTg-VD9Q8A.text: We came here based on the Yelp reviews when we were in town. So unbelievably good and the service was outstanding.

JhrPsGq6aIlTe0n2XJZNUw.text: Quick update: the service issues are much better. Great friendly new faces in there lately :-)

hsDSnYxmd4bW168tswGcgQ.text: Great spot for any occasion- especially Sunday brunch.  Pimento cheese grits were my favorite.  Great focus on local farms and ingredients.  Best new spot in the area!

GYHOAAH4dOFkXSBMaukYaw.text: Lets see, locally used organic fresh ingredients with 2 business owners that met in the industry and have a combined 30 yrs. in the kitchen! I'm a foodie, so off i go to Flipside Cafe, btw its only been open 1 week! So I originally wanted to have Breakfast/Brunch, but I was told that it was lunchtime. So I stayed and had lunch, WOW!!!! I didn't expect to be knocked off the proverbial ladder. I had the special, BBQ Chicken Sandwich and Pan Roasted Potatoes. It didn't appear to be much as the chicken and the ingredients seemed to have gotten lost inside that AWESOME BUTTERY/GARLIC BRIOCHE BUN. Wait for It-- Flavor City 101!! In the time I was there I witnessed a very new business owner, Amy, I didn't get a chance to meet Jon, run the front of the restaurant w/ tireless enthusiam. Out of the 7 people, including myself, these were the items ordered: 3 Chicken Sandwiches, 1 Hamburger, 1 Open Faced Turkey Plate, 1 Turkey Chili, and 1 Shrimp (Soy)Chorizo and Grits. Everyone was asked how they enjoyed the food, and the overall consensus was on par w/ my opinion. Thumbs Way Up, Awesome, The Best I've had, one person just shook their head and gave Two Thumbs Up. Bravo Flipside Cafe, you're on the way to a bigger location, sooner than expected! My name is D'Shawn and will definitely be going back to visit!

YSCERqJa3kIjGrw6VKlbEQ.text: Stopped in for brunch on our way to Charlotte, after my Aunt recommended it.  My Aunt is a local and knows how much I LOVE lobster.  I had the Lobster Omelette and my wife had the cinnamon toast crunch waffle.  Both were great.  I added a little hot sauce to my omelette, but not enough to overpower the flavor of the cheese and lobster.  The waffle was great.  Lightest waffle I've ever had, but I appreciated that.  Mimosas were good.  Service was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Cinnamon Toast Crunch waffle, Bacon, and the lobster omelet.  Mimosa?  Yes please.

smgNFsN-ZTTlSzb--4p9MQ.text: The most amazing meal and service I can remember in a very long time! Anne was in point! I had the Fried Green tomato BLT and fries which came out piping hot and delicious. My husband had a special plate which included fantastic peaches for brunch. This is a long drive from our home but I will make the trip again. Great gem in Ft.Mill!!!

dfFM-5NQ2fjpkWTlll0omQ.text: I always love breakfast at Flipside! Amazing grits and biscuits! Accommodating and friendly staff makes for great service every time!

JVl28DSmPerBoynpkgG4pw.text: Hands down my favorite brunch place! My husband and I are here every month at least. They sit you fast and service is top notch(Jerri at the bar is my fav!). I recommend the Soy Chorizo Hash or the waffle. Solid mimosas and bloody Mary's are really great prices (3-5 bucks)!

tDTTPCcy3jJMnAcPa6ARPg.text: Good service and food. Our waiter was great and even asked if we wanted to go waters. Thank you! I can't remember the waiters name but I It was one syllable, he had short hair, an earring, and was tall.

7D-pzUwePIbCz7rspsCjsg.text: This place was amazing, a small hole in the wall gem! Great customer service and clean. I had the steak and eggs and my boyfriend had chicken n waffles.... BEST STEAK I'VE EVER HAD!!! Will definitely be back when in Charlotte area.

Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Great fresh food

LqFHHHr30Nm0XTgTaMVYfA.text: My son and I visited the place and ordered salmon and new york strip steak.   I ordered the salmon with side salad, the salad was very old, and the steak extremely cooked, we requested to change it, and waited a long time. and this time I was very raw. It is not what I expected and I think I would not return. the waitress very slow and with bad manners.

7SJhHRSTdl3VUJmlzflGIg.text: This is our second time eating here, first for a weekend. Our first time was a couple of months ago when we came during the week while house hunting. Now that we are settled here, we came back to try the place out for a weekend brunch. This time around, our breakfast was even better than the first time (which would have also been 5 stars). Even though the place was a little busy, it did not take long to get a seat. The restaurant was easily able to handle the volume of customers flowing in. Service was never lacking and always attentive. Breakfast itself was flawless - the best I've honestly have had from a place in a long, long time. Prices are on the high side, so it is definitely a treat. Top notch all the way. Great place!

s2ZiYx6yAxFAAqUcvx5hRQ.text: Wow! I moved to Charlotte a few weeks ago and my husband and I were looking for a good place for breakfast. Flipside came up in a quick Google search and had good reviews so we decided to try it out. Pulling up to a strip mall we weren't quite sure what we were going to be experiencing. Upon walking in we were pleasantly surprised with the decor and the aroma is coming out of the kitchen. The service and the food were exceptional. This is now our Saturday go to spot for brunch. Jerri is a great server and amazing bartender. We are originally from Colorado so we were excited at the opportunity to try some southern food. Their grits are amazing. We have had the flipside special, the biscuit bake, the parm potatoes and an omelette. Everything is phenomenal! Highly recommend this great spot. I noticed they have a dinner with drink pairings I think we're going to try to schedule for the next one.

rWX5LSn7LkCPJElgXrXcMg.text: Great service. Jerri and Brooke are a couple of my favorite servers. Very attentive and great style. Sherman Burns

f-jIDwcCeXy0ChM3jFchuQ.text: Braised pork belly, ricotta gnocchi, shrimp and grits, bagette. I've not had any of these dishes before.  The ricotta gnocchi was such a creamy goodness and the mix of vegetables with it were delightful.  We had shrimp and grits with soy chorizo- I believe the spinach was a good add for the grits and the chorizo.  The bagette was served with two different butters- strawberry rhubarb and praline. Both very good. The braised pork belly was dry and I found cutting the meat like an armwrestling tournament. The server was very sweet and she tended to us in quick time.   My company made up for the braised pork, but they did tell me the sister restaurant had a better version of it. It could have been just a bad night for the chef at our restaurant.

L_wtD6W99f2CcjxJRvIebA.text: Finally tried the Flipside Cafe, and we are hooked. Tracy always takes such good care of us, she is so friendly and attentive. We also had Michael once and he was so patient and efficient. The truffle fries are SO good, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

JWPMPN3fTiiS8Vd3lDCRgA.text: Food was fabulous.  We got the steak & eggs with a side of the pimento cheese grits.  We should have stopped there because that was enough to feed 3 people!  But we also got the crunchy cinnamon waffle which was unique, and very tasty.  Those grits though... I will always remember those!  It was my first time having grits.  I am told that they are rarely cooked and flavored well, but these were excellent!  The potatoes that came with the steak and eggs were perfectly soft in the middle but crispy on the outside as well.  The reason I took off 1 star.  And please, I don't mean to be offensive towards the owner, but you NEED to do something about your bathrooms.  I don't know what the men's room looked like, but the women's room was absolutely disgusting.  I thought I walked into a nasty dive bar's bathroom.  There are splatters and stains all over the wall.  The door around the knob and towards the bottom are like, stained black from fingers touching it over the years.  I just don't know how management could use that bathroom every day and not think to themselves, damn, we need to buy a $20 can of paint, or some damn cleaner at least and clean these walls!

hq1LHry3wDEt0R0HqzuLqg.text: Flipside Cafe is an adorable cafe decorated with southern style and charm, with the friendliest and attentive service to match.  It's worth a super short drive from Charlotte for a great breakfast!  If you're a breakfast potato fan, the Potato Bravas are pretty incredible. They are perfectly and consistently crispy browned and seasoned.  I wish I could make that happen so well when I do it!  The rosemary creme fraiche takes it over the top with flavor, so good luck trying to stop yourself from devouring them. If you're not a rosemary and lemon fan, know that the rosemary lemon flavor is prominent. You may not care for them as much as I did if you're not a fan of that flavor profile.  I loved them.   The sausage gravy had nice seasoning that took it up a notch from what I've found to usually be a little more bland tasting sausage gravy elsewhere.  Biscuits were on point.  So good!  I absolutely recommend Flipside Cafe and look forward to getting back and trying more of their menu.  This could be my favorite breakfast spot in the Charlotte area.

Uxh0KwpvhqyW1Ii_8mussA.text: We arrived during the dead zone between lunch and dinner (3pm).  The place was clean and organized, so they recovered well from the lunch rush.  Alice was our server, and she was attentive and ready to discuss the beer selection and the rest of the menu.  She was passionate about the food and the restaurant - to the point I thought she might be the owner, not knowing any better.  My wife chose the "6 buck Chuck"  burger lunch special with fries, along with a side of flash-fried Brussels sprouts with bacon, drizzled in balsamic vinegar.  All the components of the burger, including the house-made pimento cheese, blended well to make an excellent burger.  The fries stayed crispy throughout the meal.  My choice was the meatloaf (grass-fed beef), wrapped in bacon, with crispy onions on the top and served over mac n cheese.  The mac n cheese was creamy and flavorful, and the meatloaf was simply terrific.  The restaurant side is soon to be renovated, to update, and more match the bar side.  It shows some sign of wear, but the tables were in excellent condition, and did not take away one bit from the quality of the meal - and that's what you're there for, anyway.  My only regret is that I'm not from the area, so I might not get there again.  If you are in the area, this is a must-visit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. 6 Buck Chuck burger, including pimento cheese.  Flash-fried Brussels sprouts and fries on the side.
Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Meatloaf, wrapped in bacon, served on mac n cheese. Perhaps the ultimate food combination?

G4vl6BQ1pKLU2j4himAIyw.text: I've been here two times and I will be back for a third. The key to a good dining experience to me and most folks is consistency. They have that here. I did not order the same meal as I did the first time instead I went with the daily breakfast special (2 eggs, grits, biscuit and gravy with bacon). They allowed me to sub bacon with tofu chorizo. Another thing I love about a restaurant, flexibility. Not too much flexibility but enough to make sure the customer is satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States

OnLxNexFZjaus0pmlEy1Zg.text: We recently had a staycation day and have been wanting to eat at Flipside. The concept is farm to table. They have a list of local farms that they purchase from. When you see that this is in a strip mall, you think, can't be too good. However, the food here is really good. The staff is a little hipster which just adds to the atmosphere. If you want good food, definitely stop here for breakfast to start your day.

MODGW3RoD-tIoRAavqMFbA.text: We stopped in on a whim and I'm sooo glad we did! The buscuit bakes are insanely delicious!!! I have no idea how they make the bacon so crispy and sweet, the gravy was delectable and the eggs were just PERFECT! Our little ones enjoyed their waffles and fresh fruits, the omelet we ordered was divine as well. I would recommend they clean their restroom doors but otherwise it's GREAT!

photos.caption: Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States

EoFeJRKhry6P7fSX46o8zw.text: Super friendly staff! Great menu and fantastic food! A hidden gem! Two coworkers and I ate lunch here. Everyone throughly enjoyed it! Already planning our next visit !

Zpi21Nk-DXhAw58lQOcQKg.text: Never lets us down, 1st class food and service.....last trip had the worlds hands down, most amazing shrimp & grits ever made! 9/23/17 follow up.....better than ever!....awesome service, new layout, larger dining room makes it much more comfortable.....no need to comment on food, 1st class, cooked perfectly, great choices, fair prices...go, go, go!

S5mZ-6DKjWdpmXYECuLbvw.text: Quite possibly might be my favorite breakfast I've had in the Charlotte area. Flipside cafe is super unassuming in a like a strip mall shopping center. Upon walking in I was instantly greeted and seated. The server came over right away, she was super friendly and did a great job taking care of our table.  At the table we ordered a mimosa (yes on a Thursday afternoon don't judge me), coffee, potatoes bravas, veggie omelet, blt, and the fort mill breakfast bake. Nothing disappointed! So these potatoes omg, I'm a sucker for breakfast potatoes but these were amazing! Super crispy, well seasoned, topped with the creme fraiche, some lemony goodness, and herbs, serious perfection! The biscuit bake, so good, cast iron crust but a light fluffy biscuit, and the smoked bacon on top with cheese and gravy, oh my goodness.   Huge portions, fairly priced, great staff, I can't wait to go back!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Veggie Omelet
Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Potatoes Bravas

8h6K0mcuVY_r-Owa_10Dxw.text: Always a good vibe and good food. Staff is courteous and Gerry (hope that's correct) is awesome. For a mom with 3 girls, she has energy to burn.  Todays menu saw us ordering a delicious salad, a flipside burger, salmon. Everything was fresh and tasty. Desert was a Strawberry shortcake and peach cobbler... again delicious..  Now I am forced to roll out stuffed to the brim...  Clean, free parking, good atmosphere and service... "flip the switch" and come over to this side and enjoy.....

x3c5BGifkgulU4Sp6UNqEQ.text: What a find!!!!!!!  Driving through South Carolina and found this gem. If I lived in town this would be my go to place for breakfast.   Less then 5 minutes off of I-77. Allow yourself a slight detour and you will be extremely satisfied.   Everything was fresh, perfectly cooked and delicious.   Throw caution to the window and forget what you doctor says. Have the bacon... it's worth it. Do yourself a favor and treat yourself to the Carolina Grits with pimento cheeses and bacon jam. Trust me you will thank me.   Words cannot describe the food-gasm you will experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Daily special - 2 eggs anyway, bacon, grits &amp; discutí with sausage gravy. Had eggs softly scrambled and upgraded grits to Carolina Grits.
Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Flip Biscuit Bake

GYOPhwJhjW2_8Aq6r2mjVA.text: This hidden gem deserves all the praise and "best of" lists it already has and more. From the impeccable service (thanks Jerri) and spot on menu recommendations to the superb twist on locally inspired comfort food and modern rustic ambience, this place is absolutely worth a little drive.   The soy chorizo hash is the perfect balance of spicy, salty with a touch of sweet from the onions. The cheesy grits with house made pimento cheese and bacon jam toppings are the stuff of legends.   Jerri is a delight, she went out of her way to make me a "flat white" style coffee we drink in Australia and totally nailed it. It's a great team here, with a vibe of collaboration and a passion for their work. This love shows through in the delicious food!   I've had many great meals on my travels, this one will stand out as one of the best with the wining trifecta of great food, great people, and great digs.

photos.caption: Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Cheesy Carolina Grits
Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Great flat white coffee
Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Soy chorizo hash

U4VTdtO2pcMmOZ9YYzj6CA.text: The atmosphere was nice.  A good place for Sunday brunch.   I ordered the Flipside breakfast and it was delicious. Biscuit and gravy YUM! Bacon crispy! EGGS were absolutely DELICIOUS!! The grits were okay.   Customer service was good well.  I will definitely be visiting again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Flipside Breakfast

x6zHaWiF2LPg7VtxrHqf6Q.text: Ack - I need to update my review! Those low star reviews were from a long time ago, and Flipside has become a go-to restaurant for us since then. We don't make it there for dinner as much as we should, but I feel like they should inscribe my name on a barstool for the number of times we visit for Sunday brunch.   Everything is good, service is great, I love the new side they opened with the bar, and this place is amazing. Sorry it took so long to realize I needed to update my review!!

ogUV5UgehPxgXBDEUd6zng.text: Hidden Gem on the South/North Carolina border!! Great food awesome atmosphere! Wonderful staff! Jerry was the best! Xoxo  #flipsidehaveyoudoingflips

photos.caption: Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Short Rib Hash sooooo goood! Recommended by Jerry! Look for her when you come in best ever! Awesome personality!

IhNOhXmerYJ6ZIzP5m2D1Q.text: Came here for breakfast, and it did not disappoint. The restaurant itself it's cute and modern at the same time, with odes to southern staples- like pimento cheese and BBQ. There is also a board with all the local farms, markets, gardens they utilize in their restaurant. Which, I'll admit, I'm a sucker for places that support local.   The breakfast itself was good, nothing over the top, but good. The eggs were cooked perfectly, and the sausage gravy was delicious. The biscuit itself was a little dry, even with the gravy. I went for the upcharge and got their roasted potatoes, and honestly, I didn't think they were worth it. Some were burnt and some were pretty raw. The bacon was perfectly cooked...crispy and melt-y all at the same time. The coffee falls in the "good coffee" category - robust, flavorful and smooth - I'd take a cup of that any day!   This is definitely a spot I would come back to, and would love to try their lunches or dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Daily breakfast.

_wDWSQacBA8LOd2YnldOww.text: Flipside is close to me and I've been to the other location, the Flipside restaurant in Rock Hill for business dinners and thought we'd try it on a Thursday night.   The location is a bit strange, as it's kind of in a run down shopping plaza.  When we walked in and there were basically 2 sides to the restaurant and we were seated at the table right by the bathrooms.  I should have said something, but whatever. What I liked about Flipside is that they can accommodate my daughters celiac and the staff is educated enough to let us know what is safe to eat and what isn't.  She had the Shrimp & Grits which was excellent. I ordered the ribs at the waitresses recommendation.  They were great.  Healthy portion, good sauce and pretty damn meaty.  Side of well prepared collard greens and cole slaw.  Food was great and at a nice price point.  We'll be back.

aPZQrcpSaUI-9FX-1G3VQA.text: The staff here has always been one of my favorite parts. I usually only show up for brunch which is almost always slammed, but I haven't run across anyone having a bad day. Ever. They're talented, quick, offer suggestions and even if they're tired, they're smiling through it.  Now, as good as the staff is, the food is even better. While the grits always need a side of salt (which I get because you don't want to oversalt for those with medical situations and such), that's a small thing that's barely worth mentioning (unless you like salt in your grits, so I did. lol).  On the most recent visit, I got the Flipside Breakfast with a biscuit with gravy, bacon, grits and two eggs anyway. I got the eggs scrambled and when I tell you they were piping hot, I am not exaggerating. I was so excited. I got the bacon crispy and it had just the right snap. The biscuit was so light and fluffy and it was a perfect vehicle for getting gravy into my face.   The husband got the Maine Lobster omelet and I specifically asked for a piece, but did not get one before his plate was completely cleared. So, I have concluded that it was delicious.  Special note: Mimosas for $4 and Bloody Mary's for $5 at brunch.  If there's only two in your party, try the bar if you go for brunch. They're pretty crowded on the weekend mornings!

huAkwB2X9wG--xzHWZt0_Q.text: My dining mates and I had dinner here for the first time. What a wonderful culinary experience. The ambience was comfortable, the staff friendly and accomodating and the food most wonderful in all ways: attractive plating, good portions, reasonable prices but most of all downright delicious. We shared appetizers of avocado stuffed bread, crab cakes, fried brussel sprouts,  white cheddar pimento cheese, plus autumn squash soup, tomato soup , entrees of chicken salad sandwich, beef on weck and the Flipside burger with a side of grilled asparagus. Everything just delicious, well seasoned nothing overly salty or spicy. We would certainly return and try different menu choices. This restaurant is a cut above so to speak in my opinion from other restaurants in the area.

P_dgrwuMECgeNGSh7jbF3A.text: Found this place on yelp. Stopped in on our way back to Charleston from Charlotte. Really thankful we did. The food was delicious the drinks were good and the service was awesome. We will return next time we are passing through.

Q3tp8-faGMxD6MP1SdSXYQ.text: Made a trip down to Ft Mill to check out Flipside Cafe today for lunch.  I had been years ago and was happy to see that they have since expanded and essentially doubled the seating.  We were quickly given a table. Our waiter was very friendly but the service could have been better - we had to ask a few times for things we needed - straws, silverware, more drinks etc.  The food was great!.  For apps we had the pimento cheese with the pretzels - it comes with 2 pretzels but you can request they add on however many you want for an additional fee. I had the Fried green tomato BLT with the truffle fries.  I really love their pimento cheese, so good! I would like to go back for brunch sometime. For sure a must try if in the area!

MO7s0s0Oj1xHJ4FdOASbWQ.text: Stopped in for brunch after the farmers market and found the service to be outstanding. Which was a great match with the locally sources and inspired southern dishes.  Pleasantly surprised by the high quality coffee, and definitely impressed with the sky-high fluffy biscuit. The servers and kitchen were extremely accomodating, especially with series of veggie substitutions for one of our party who was on a low-carb diet.  No easy feat in the South! Will likely return for dinner where the menu looks innovative, affordable and tasty.  Note: location isn't really visible from the road, but tucked away in a small strip mall.  Also, this is a small joint, its not easy to anyone a large party, although the staff will do their best. Stick to groups smaller than 6.

photos.caption: Photo of The Flipside Cafe - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Flipside breakfast: biscuit &amp;gravy, cheesy grits and scrambled eggs topped with bacon. Bonus delicious, better -than-diner coffee

cqUwJanWNPn7R2aa1MyWHw.text: Man I tell ya. I really wanted to give this place 5 stars.   Service was overall great, food was on point, and the atmosphere was chill.   But they forgot our app.   Ordered a couple salads, both Kale Caesars. I did shrimp. She did chicken. And an order of Brussels sprouts, our favorite app/side "to start". They were even a recommended dish. Queue my Pavlovian response cycle and concurrent mouth watering. Bring on the Brussels!!   But they never came.   Our salads came and we were Brussels-less.   Our server was attentive and they were "coming right up" and came out piping hot....suspiciously like they had just been cooked.   They were awesome. Not too sweet. Not too salty. Perfect amount of bacon mixed in. They just didn't come on time.   We will be back for sure. And hopefully can switch into 5 star mode.
